data.event: The city was named for Ada Reed, the daughter of an early settler, and was incorporated in 1901.
In the late 1880s, the Daggs family (by way of Texas) became the first white family to settle what is now known as Ada, which was formerly known as Daggs Prairie.

event.title: April 1889, Jeff Reed (a native Texan, and relative of the Daggs family) was appointed

data.event: In April 1889, Jeff Reed (a native Texan, and relative of the Daggs family) was appointed to carry the mail from Stonewall to Center (which was later combined with Pickett), two small communities in then Indian Territory.

event.title: 1891, a post office was established and named

data.event: In 1891, a post office was established and named after Reed's oldest daughter, Ada.
Ada incorporated as a city in 1901 and grew rapidly with the arrival of the St. Louis and San Francisco Railway line.

event.title: a decade the Santa Fe Railroad and the Oklahoma Central Railway also served

data.event: Within a decade the Santa Fe Railroad and the Oklahoma Central Railway also served the town.
